title: Javascript and the DOM
details: Practice Vanilla JS and DOM by creating a tic-tac-toe game using click events and a reset button. Include a dark/light mode toggle using an html checkbox and the change event. Add simple animations to the game for a smoother and more satisfying user experience.

title: HTML Forms
details: A pure HTML/CSS form that can be linked to a SQL/noSQL database after the fact. Currently a demo to invite friends to hangout together.

title: Javascript Debugging Practice
details: Find and fix the errors on the quiz and post the fixed version to your portal. Hint: there are no errors in the CSS file, only the HTML file and the JavaScript file.

title: Playing with APIs and JSON
details: Make a weather app that takes inspiration from Karen, of the movie Mean Girls, using the Geolocation API and the OpenWeatherApp API. The app only shows two pieces of information: the precipitation probability and the icon data that corresponds to the current weather conditions in the user's location. API data is refreshed every 5 minutes and will display default data if users do not want to allow the app to access their location data.

title: Practice with JavaScript Libraries
details: Add animations on scroll using the AOS JS library to a copy of my assignments page (this one) to see if it is a viable design choice in the future. The import broke when I wasn't looking, but the end result was viable enough that I am recreating this project in React, as imports seem to be more stable that way.

title: Design Component Layout for a React To-Do App
details: Use React JS documentation, knowledge of OOP, and the modular nature of React Functional Components to design the rough layout of a simple to-do app using React.
